item.title: Second Post
item.description: Welcome to my second post! I’m excited to share more insights and updates. Stay tuned for more content coming your way.

item.title: First Post
item.description:
What is Azure Active Directory (AAD)?

Azure Active Directory (AAD) is Microsoft’s cloud-based identity and access management service. It enables organizations to manage user authentication, control access to resources, and enhance security for apps and services.

Key Features:

  • Single Sign-On (SSO): Simplifies user access to multiple applications with a single login.
  • Conditional Access: Provides advanced security controls based on user location, device, and behavior.
  • Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA): Strengthens authentication with additional verification layers.
  • Identity Protection: Detects and mitigates identity-related threats using machine learning.
  • Application Management: Allows administrators to register, monitor, and manage apps securely.

AAD is an essential service for organizations adopting Microsoft 365, Azure, or other cloud-based solutions, ensuring seamless identity and security management across platforms.
